creator: vdv@dyomedea.com
text:
IMO (confirmed on xmlschema-dev), this schema should be valid:

XSD:
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
				<xs:element name="tests">
						<xs:complexType>
								<xs:choice minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded">
												<xs:element name="token" type="token"/>
												<xs:element name="string" type="string"/>
								</xs:choice>
				   </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
				<xs:simpleType name="simpleString" >
												<xs:restriction base="xs:string">
																<xs:pattern value=""/>
												</xs:restriction>
								</xs:simpleType>
				<xs:complexType name="string">
						<xs:simpleContent>
												<xs:extension base="simpleString"/>
						</xs:simpleContent>
				</xs:complexType>
				<xs:complexType name="token">
						<xs:simpleContent>
								<xs:restriction base="string">
											<xs:whiteSpace value="collapse"/>
								</xs:restriction>
						</xs:simpleContent>
				</xs:complexType>
</xs:schema>

but it gives:

[Error] empty.xml:2:52: Schema error: ComplexType 'token': Invalid child in the
RESTRICTION element of simpleContent.

See also:

http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/xmlschema-dev/2001Nov/0134.html


Thanks

Eric

creator: sandygao@ca.ibm.com
text:
Fixed in CVS: allow <whiteSpace> as a child of <restriction> under 
<simpleContent>.
A modified version from Pavani's patch. Thanks, Pavani.

creator: vdv@dyomedea.com
text:
Just a confirmation that this is working for me... and that I am more than
impressed by your reactivity!

Thanks

Eric
